app.desc:
A large-sized rechargeable battery pack for your Raspberry Pi. Inside is a massive 10,000mAh lithium ion battery, a charging circuit and two boost converters that provide 5VDC, 1A and 2A each via a USB A port.
This part can only be used with Raspberry Pi.

An easy to replace power option, as you can always refresh the batteries in this holder quite easily. Use for circuits that require porting. Also contains a switch which allows you to turn the circuit power on and off easily..
A standard 9V battery, useful for circuits that required to be ported or are not located near wall power.
An easy to replace power option, as you can always refresh the batteries in this holder quite easily. Also contains a switch which allows you to turn the circuit power on and off easily..

A 12V power source you plug into your regular socket. Works with 100-240VAC inputs. The most reliable and most likely to work for all components you choose. Use it when you don’t need your circuit to be mobile, or positioned in a location without wall power.

A 12V power source you plug into your regular socket. Works with 100-240VAC inputs. The most reliable and most likely to work for all components you choose. Use it when you don’t need your circuit to be mobile, or positioned in a location without wall power.

A 5V2.5A power supply for your Raspberry PI. Works with 90-264VAC inputs. The most reliable and most likely to work well with Raspberry PI. Use it when you don’t need your circuit to be mobile, or positioned in a location without wall power.
This part can only be used with Raspberry Pi.

app.appName: USB Cable A to B - 6 Foot
app.desc: A standard USB cable to power your circuit from your computer or a USB socket.
A standard Micro USB cable to power your circuit from your computer or a USB socket.
A standard Mini USB cable to power your circuit from your computer or a USB socket.

A great way to power any R/C, robotic, or portable project. This is an excellent choice for anything that requires a small battery with a lot of punch.
The battery has two cells and outputs 7.4V.
Because this is a dual cell battery pack, a special charger is needed. It is not compatible with single cell chargers.

A great way to power any R/C, robotic, or portable project. This is an excellent choice for anything that requires a small battery with a lot of punch.
The battery has one cell and outputs 3.7V.
